page.title: 14HISTORY OF PLAYING PLACE/KEA
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY In{Domesday }1086 there is an entry for{Landighe}manor.There is at the present, an old cottage on the site. Most of the houses in{Porth Kea}are over 100 years old.The village pump still exists but the well is no longer in use.Some houses have septic tanks. The area is famous for {Kea Plums brought here in the {Reign }of {Elizabeth 1st,}but only here do they grow to plum size. { Henry Martin,}a missionary who translated the Bible into{Hindu}and {Persian,}lived at{Woodbury Hse.Coombe. The{Roman}encampment at{Roundwood now only consists of earth, the stones having been taken to build{TRELISSICK. { Tregew}farm is supposed to be haunted by a ghost. During World War 2 the{U.S.army }had a base in a field at Carlyon Farm.
